p: The results of the Mann Kendall and linear regression tests, which tested the hypothesis that there is no trend in rainfall and temperature are presented in Table 3. Mann Kendall test revealed significant trends in minimum and maximum temperature, at p = 0.001 and p = 0.021, respectively. These findings were also revealed by the regression results which showed that the trends of minimum and maximum temperature were significant at p = 0.001 and 0.006 respectively. Similar observations have been reported by a study in Kenya ( Chepkoech et al., 2018).
